subject: Pro X Ultra pedals showing disconnected
description_text: Hello, I am trying to set up a new set of Simsonn Pro X Ultra pedals. They are plugged into the Simsonn control box, and that is plugged into my PC via USB. The RGB lights all came on when I connect to the PC. When I try to run the Simsonn manager software, it says the pedals are disconnected and I cannot get any of them to calibrate or read any signal. Please advise how to get this working. Thank you!

conversations.body_text: Hi Jason Purdie,    Please finish installing the shifter first, then install the Todesk tool on your PC. I can assist you remotely today. Todesk does not require registration—just provide the ID and temporary password after launching the program.  https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

Pedals work in game, but Simsonn software doesn’t recognize that they are connected.  I need to adjust the deadzones because throttle pedal is only reading 95% at max position.  Is there any recommendation without allowing Remote Desktop control?  I’d rather not do that.


>

Hi Jason Purdie,  Please press the upgrade button on the ProX Ultra control box, then reconnect the USB. The control box will enter recovery mode. Open SIMSONN Manager 2.0.8, and go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → Pedals, then select the proxultra-nosign.sfu firmware file I sent you. After the update is complete, simply click the "Restore" button to return to normal operation.
